TextBody:
Hi Marius,

Thank you for your email.
This is a known issue currently- and we are investigating it.
For the time being, you can disregard the upgrade.
For some reason, even if applied, the update does not go away from the queue, and can even be applied multiple
times.
If you go to Dashboard- Live Update- View Applied EPP Software Updates- and see that as per below was applied,
as mentioned , disregard the"hotfix" update which still lingers on


Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery
Email | Website | LinkedIn
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CVVF7:ref
Subject: Hotfix cant' be installed    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CVVF7:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CVVF7:ref

Hi,

okay thanks for the answer.
Another problem which we have is that the newest client version we can push is 6.2.2.1. Normally it should be the 6.2.2.2 right?
Is it also a known issue?

BR
Marius

TextBody:
Hi Marius,

Yes, of sorts- so the Vulnerability upgradation, comes in two stages.
1- Server upgrade- which you already applied- but it still lingers on
2-CLients upgrade- I will leave the links here for them as well. This is not a bug- the hickup is that the clients upgrade were not injected in the #1 fix,
but we are looking into perhapse injecting them all together.
MacOS:  https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPMac3.0.2.2005.Notarized.tar
Windows:  https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPClient_v6.2.2.2005.zip


Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery
Email | Website | LinkedIn

TextBody:
Hi Marius,

Thank you for your email.
As far as the updates go- it seems that the lingering patch issue will be addressed in the future server release version- so 5.9.4.0.
It would seem that this was a feature, and not a bug.
As for the clients being downloadable from the UI, there are no current updates on this.

Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

but we are looking into perhapse injecting them all together.
